title: Leather Goddesses of Phobos
author: Inspired by Steve Meretzky's Classic
intro:
It's 1936. You're in a seedy bar in Upper Sandusky, Ohio, nursing a drink
and contemplating life's disappointments.

Suddenly, nature calls. You head to the restroom. But when you emerge,
everything has changed. An alien just walked past. Your bartender has
tentacles. And someone slipped a strange device into your pocket.

Before you can process this, a holographic message activates:

'Greetings, Earthling! The Leather Goddesses of Phobos plan to enslave
your planet using their Kinetic Integrated Sinister Sex-ray! You must
stop them! Collect the three vital components scattered across space
and time, build the Anti-Leather-Goddess-of-Phobos Device, and save Earth!

Oh, and try not to die. Good luck!'

Well, this beats another boring Tuesday.

Note: This is a TAME version. The original had adjustable naughtiness levels.

rooms.name: Joe's Bar - Upper Sandusky, Ohio, 1936
rooms.description:
A dingy bar that's seen better decades. The bartender (who definitely
didn't have tentacles a minute ago) polishes glasses with disturbing
nonchalance. The restroom doors are marked 'MALE' and 'FEMALE' (choose
wisely - it determines your adventure partner). Exit is south.

rooms.name: Main Street - Upper Sandusky
rooms.description:
Main Street looks normal, if you ignore the flying saucer parked near
the courthouse and the Martian buying a newspaper. North is the bar.
East leads to the town square. A suspicious alley is west.

rooms.name: Interdimensional Restroom
rooms.description:
This restroom exists between dimensions. Graffiti on the walls is in
alien languages. A portal shimmers in the mirror. One stall is labeled
'MARS', another 'VENUS', a third 'PHOBOS'. Choose carefully.

rooms.name: Town Square
rooms.description:
A quaint town square with a gazebo and statue of some forgotten politician.
A TIME MACHINE disguised as a phone booth is here (subtle). West is Main Street.

rooms.name: Time Machine Interior
rooms.description:
Bigger on the inside (naturally). Controls are labeled for various
eras and locations. Current setting: RANDOM. A note says 'Don't touch
the pink button.' The square is outside.

rooms.name: Ancient Egypt - 2000 BCE
rooms.description:
You've materialized near the Sphinx. Pyramids loom in the distance.
A confused pharaoh is arguing with a leather-clad goddess about building codes.
The time machine is east.

rooms.name: Inside the Great Pyramid
rooms.description:
Torch-lit passages. Hieroglyphs cover the walls. One shows what appears
to be ancient Martians teaching Egyptians mathematics. A secret chamber
is hidden behind a loose stone. Egypt is west.

rooms.name: Secret Chamber
rooms.description:
An alien artifact rests on a pedestal: THE HYPER-DIMENSIONAL RUBBER DUCK.
Yes, really. It's one of the three components you need. The pyramid is out.

rooms.name: Mysterious Alley
rooms.description:
A dark alley that shouldn't exist in Upper Sandusky. A door marked
'INTER-PLANETARY TRADING POST' glows softly. Main Street is east.

rooms.name: Trading Post
rooms.description:
A shop selling goods from across the galaxy. Weapons, gadgets, mysterious
potions. The shopkeeper is a blob from Rigel VII. It accepts Earth money
(currently 1936 dollars). The alley is out.

rooms.name: Mars - Canals District
rooms.description:
The famous Martian canals, which turn out to be real. Red sand, pink
sky, and improbable architecture. Martians in leather jackets lounge
around. A casino is north. The restroom portal is south.

rooms.name: Martian Casino
rooms.description:
Gambling! Martian-style! Games include 'Spin the Asteroid' and 'Tentacle
Poker'. You could win useful items here. The canals are south.

rooms.name: Martian Junkyard
rooms.description:
Piles of discarded alien technology. A tinkerer's paradise or a junk
heap, depending on perspective. THE QUANTUM SPATULA might be here somewhere.
The canals are west.

rooms.name: Venus - Jungle Clearing
rooms.description:
Dense jungle under a thick cloud cover. Everything is damp and green.
Alien plants try to sell you insurance. North leads deeper into jungle.
The restroom portal is south.

rooms.name: Temple of the Cosmic Kipper
Phobos - Leather Goddess Headquarters
rooms.description:
You've infiltrated the enemy stronghold! Leather Goddesses strut around
in impractical footwear. The throne room is north. This is dangerous.
The restroom portal is south (escape route).

rooms.name: Throne Room of the Leather Goddesses
rooms.description:
Three goddesses recline on thrones, discussing their evil plan. The
Kinetic Integrated Sinister Sex-ray looms ominously. You need to activate
your Anti-Leather-Goddess-of-Phobos Device here. Phobos entrance is south.

items.name: interdimensional hopper
items.description: A small device that creates portals. Mysteriously appeared in your pocket. Smells like ozone and regret.

items.name: rubber duck
items.description: THE HYPER-DIMENSIONAL RUBBER DUCK. One of three components. It exists in multiple dimensions simultaneously. Still squeaks.

items.name: quantum spatula
items.description: THE QUANTUM SPATULA. Component two. Can flip pancakes and reality. Mostly reality.

items.name: celestial cheesecloth
items.description: THE CELESTIAL CHEESECLOTH. The third component. Woven from cosmic dairy byproducts. Don't ask.

items.name: Martian whiskey
items.description: Potent Martian alcohol. 200 proof. Possibly flammable. Definitely inadvisable.

items.name: scratch-and-sniff card
items.description: An alien scratch-and-sniff card. Smells like purple. Yes, purple has a smell now.

items.name: disguise kit
items.description: A complete disguise kit. Includes fake tentacles, leather outfit, and an attitude.

items.name: assembly instructions
items.description: Instructions for building the Anti-Leather-Goddess-of-Phobos Device. Written in 47 languages, none helpful.

monsters.name: Trent
monsters.description: Your randomly-assigned adventure companion. Brave, loyal, and confused about what's happening. Attracted to you but terrible at expressing it.

monsters.name: Leather Goddess #1 - Tawny
monsters.description: Tall, imperious, and dressed in impractical leather. Leader of the trio. Surprisingly good at chess.

monsters.name: Martian hustler
monsters.description: A Martian trying to sell you 'authentic' Earth artifacts. Everything is suspiciously from the future.

monsters.name: tentacle bartender
monsters.description: Your bartender from Joe's Bar. Now has tentacles. Still makes a mean martini. Doesn't want to discuss the tentacles.

dialogues.greeting: I... I don't understand what's happening. But I'm with you. Whatever this is.

topics.response: I can carry stuff, fight leather goddesses, and provide moral support. Also, I'm pretty sure I'm falling for you, but this isn't the time.
Evil alien dominatrices trying to enslave Earth? Sure, why not. This week can't get weirder.

dialogues.greeting: Foolish Earthling! You dare challenge the Leather Goddesses of Phobos?

topics.response: We will enslave your planet with our Kinetic Integrated Sinister Sex-ray! Earth will bow before us in fashionable leather!
Negotiate? We are goddesses! We don't negotiate! Well... maybe over dinner. Are you free Thursday?

dialogues.greeting: Hey pal! Want to buy authentic Earth artifacts? Got a genuine 1987 Walkman right here!

topics.response: What? Oh, uh... time flows differently on Mars. Yeah. That's it.

dialogues.greeting: What'll it be? And please don't mention the tentacles.

topics.response: *sighs* It happened when reality shifted. I'm adapting. At least I can multitask now.

quests.name: Collect the Three Components
quests.description: Find the Hyper-Dimensional Rubber Duck, Quantum Spatula, and Celestial Cheesecloth.

quests.name: Build the Anti-Leather-Goddess Device
quests.description: Assemble the three components into a functional device.

quests.name: Defeat the Leather Goddesses
quests.description: Infiltrate Phobos and stop the Kinetic Integrated Sinister Sex-ray!

notes: Inspired by Steve Meretzky's 'Leather Goddesses of Phobos' (1986), Infocom
Original had three 'naughtiness' levels - this is the TAME version
Famous for absurdist humor and time-travel shenanigans
Player could choose gender at start (restroom choice)
Came with scratch-and-sniff card in original packaging
Intentionally silly and irreverent tone throughout
Multiple solutions to puzzles encouraged creativity
